result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Arlin Roblero Bravo was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant was granted 95 days credit for time served.
Per State Statute 343.301(2m), Ignition Interlock Device requirement begins on the date the Dept. of Transportation issues any license under Chapt. 343.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arlin Roblero Bravo

records.addlTxt: Original Bond returned by Sherrif's Department unsigned / not posted.

12:34 PM Attorney Melissa S. Inlow appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Arlin Roblero Bravo appeared, pro se by video from Clark County Jail.    Susan Rascon sworn as interpreter, appeared by video.  All appeared throiugh Zoom.    Defendant finalized waiver of right to an attorney after full colloquy.  The defendant pled guilty to the charge. Rights given. Court finds that he has entered his plea knowingly, intelligently and of his own free will and finds the defendant guilty.  The State is in compliance with Victim Rights Law.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.

02:50 PM Attorney Melissa S. Inlow appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Arlin Roblero Bravo appeared, pro se    Interpreter Enrique Soria was previously sworn and present to interpret.  Court questioning the letter the defendant sent all in Spanish.  He is asking for a bond modification.  Set for plea and sentencing  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Pre-trial conference on March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on April 19, 2022 at 02:50 pm.

03:08 PM Attorney Melissa Inlow appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Arlin Roblero Bravo appeared, pro se in custody from Clark County Jail    Susan Rascon, previously sworn as interpreter  Interpeter read the CC to him and he waives the reading of the CC by the court.    Not Guilty Plea entered by the Court on behalf of the defendant  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 02:50 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 15, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

11:47 AM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Arlin Roblero Bravo appeared, pro se by video from Clark County Jail.    Susan Rascon, previously sworn as interpreter  Defendant does not want an attorney.  Defendant wants the criminal complaint read to him. Hearing adjourned and rescheduled to later in the day.   Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 15, 2022 at 11:45 am.

09:59 AM Attorney Melissa S. Inlow appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Arlin Roblero Bravo appeared, pro se by video from Clark County Jail    Susan Rascon, previously sworn as interpreter  Defendant will seek an attrney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Initial appearance on February 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant is not to drive any motorized vehicle: (a) unless defendant is in possession of a valid Wisconsin operator's license for the type of motor vehicle being driven; (b) defendant and such motor vehicle are insured as required by law; and (c) defendant is in possession of valid proof of insurance while operating the motor vehicle.

01:07 PM Attorney Melissa S. Inlow appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Arlin Roblero Bravo appeared, pro se by video   Interpreter Enrique Soria was sworn and present to interpret by video.    Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.    Defendant advised of right to an attorney.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
